alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 7:03AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Ventura. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 AM PST, heavier rains have ended, though areas of light to moderate rain continue moving across the advisory area. This will support the continued potential for minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Rose Valley, Ventura Harbor, Newbury Park, Point Mugu State Park, Point Mugu, La Conchita, Rincon Point, Oak Park, Somis and El Rio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
